attributes.action: Give all carers with SGO the same allowance regardless of income
attributes.background:
Carers with SGOs keep children out of the care system.  Some of us get an allowance, others don't.  
We get deductions from these allowances, yet we do the same as foster carers who get larger allowances. 
We have the additional issues of emotional attatchement to these children.
attributes.additional_details:
We care for children who have a lot of emotional issues,  we keep them out of the care system because we have a heart and love these children as if they were our own. Yet we get penalised for this, some SGO carers get no help bringing these children up and giving them the life every child deserves.
The government should not make deductions to allowances and should make the allowance the same for every carer regardless of income.

attributes.action: Do not ban 'cartoon characters' from 'unhealthy foods'.
attributes.background: MPs on the Health Committee wish to ban cartoon characters on 'unhealthy food' (such as Tony the Tiger & Nestle's Milky Bar Kid). These brand mascots have been around for decades yet obesity rates are only very high now due to bad parenting.
attributes.additional_details: Link to BBC Article - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-44298135

attributes.action: UK residents aged 16 and 17 year olds should be able to vote in referendums.
attributes.background: I think that people in the UK who were 16/17 should be able to vote in referendums. An example of this I think that 16/17 should have been able to vote in the EU referendum and weren't allowed to and leaving the EU will affect those who weren't able to vote in it, me being one of those individuals.

attributes.action: Make Government Funds Available for Victims & Families of Terrorist Attacks
attributes.background:
I was shocked to recently learn that there is ‘No’ financial funding help for victims or their families of terrorist attacks in the U.K. 
In light of the Manchester Arena bombing, and the 22 victims, London Bridge Attack, Westminster Attack, Finsbury Park Attack in 2017 we should be helping.
attributes.additional_details:
Financial Funds need to be made available for victims and their families , and those who have been affected by incidents of terrorism in the United Kingdom. There needs to be a special fund set up to help these people, and their families who need to take time off work, to look after family members, general living expenses, and specialist care.
This is the least we can do as a nation, to help people who need it the most. After experiencing such life affecting atrocities!

attributes.action: Revert the Design & Technology Resistant Materials GCSE to its prior curriculum
attributes.background:
I signed up to make stuff
Now I am learning about cotton
I did not sign up for this

attributes.action: Decriminalise drug possession
attributes.background: People are currently being needlessly prosecuted for consuming drugs. This method has proved innefective in curbing drug use and deaths. By decriminalising drug possession we can save millions of pounds on convictions and invest in harm reduction methods and education as shown effective by Portugal.
attributes.additional_details: As shown by this link https://www.statista.com/chart/10320/drug-deaths-in-europe/ Portugal's system of decriminalisation has resulted in the lowest death rate from drugs if any country in Europe. By decriminalising drug possession users and addicts alike can get help to stop their addiction and use drugs in a safer manner. Moreover, the majority of drug users do not pose a threat to society and their lives are being ruined due to unjust drug laws. We help the disabled, why not drug users?

attributes.action: Make it illegal for freeholders to receive insurance commission over 10%
attributes.background: Landlords and/or their associates receive hidden commission on buildings insurance at the expense of leasehold owners, and this is often grossly excessive.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous Lands Tribunal cases correcting this but this would not be necessary if it was made law.

attributes.action: Give disabled victims of crime funding for support & services to obtain justice!
attributes.background: Disabled people such as those suffering with Autism find dealing with stress and anxiety very difficult, especially when they are victims of crime, it has a huge negative impact on their health, their life both at work and at home as well as their mental well being.
attributes.additional_details: Adequate funding and support should always be available via a bespoke fund for those disabled victims such as autistics or those with mental disabilities ensuring their needs are met to provide the services and support required so the most vulnerable in our society, who struggle to cope with life in general, let alone when they are the victims of crime are not left alone to deal with courts, ombudsman, regulators, MP's, media and police plus all the paperwork and documentation it entails.

attributes.action: Increase British military spending to £65 Billion
attributes.background: The UK’s military spending is way to low with the threats in N.Korea, Syria and Russia we need to increase spending please sign this petition to increase military spending

attributes.action: Make anywhere serving fresh food to be required to provide free tap water.
attributes.background:
I think that any premises serving fresh food should be required to provide tap water and refill reusable water bottles up to 1ltr for free. 
This should include people who aren’t customers.

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote before the UK engages with military action in Libya
attributes.background: Further to previous Middle East conflicts and their outcome, it is imperative that we have a democratic vote by elected MPs on whether the UK should be involved in an escalation of military activity in Libya

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow boys to wear shorts.
attributes.background: Most schools no longer give boys the option to wear shorts except when taking part in physical education however all schools allow girls to wear skirts. This is sexist and should be resolved by requiring schools to allow boys to wear shorts.

attributes.action: Make financial management a compulsory part of education in schools
attributes.background:
The national level of personal debt in this country is on the rise. It will only get worse unless something is done now.

Proper financial management has to be taught in schools from a young age to prepare children for the future.

This could be included in maths or done as a separate subject.
attributes.additional_details:
I work in local government, dealing with insolvency and large debts on a daily basis. I've seen so many cases where people clearly don't know how to manage their finances and need solid advice on how to budget.

National statistics for Individual Voluntary Arrangements (IVAs) show that they are steadily on the rise since their introduction. However, I've seen several terminted because people can't make enough sacrifices and stick to arrangements. This then leads to harsher financial penalties.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for vendors to produce a Home Survey prior to marketing
attributes.background:
I paid for 1 survey & vendors withdrew from market
Paid for survey on 2nd house & found pure asbestos
Paid for survey on 3rd house & found structural movement
Paid for survey to buy 4th house
And other buyers will also have to pay for surveys on those same houses.

attributes.action: Start a voluntary emigration programme for people who want to leave the UK.
attributes.background: I am sick and tired of living in a small country with an ever increasing population and lack of government investment in jobs, housing, opportunities, transport, healthcare and poor standard of living.
attributes.additional_details:
You would be paid up to £100,000 by the Government to give up your British citizenship, if you’re entitled to another citizenship, in exchange for leaving the UK to settle elsewhere.

 

A contract can be signed, so that if someone changes their mind they will be liable to pay back the sum of money, if they want to gain back their citizenship. They will also not be able to join the scheme again.

attributes.action: Restrict social media use by children to help prevent cyberbullying
attributes.background:
We urge Parliament to consider new laws, banning the posting of content to social media / video-sharing sites by under-18s. 

Children should be focussed on developing real life social skills, and deserve a childhood free from the pressures and bullying which go hand in hand with social media use.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media / video-sharing websites are often used as a way to bully other children, and in some cases teachers too, something from which the victim has no opportunity to escape, even at home.

Children should not be posting content online, until they have reached an age at which they have been fully educated about its use/misuse, can understand the emotional damage bullying online may cause, and the legal ramifications of broadcasting inappropriate content or making libelous remarks online.

attributes.action: Make nonconsensual medical intervention for intersexed people illegal.
attributes.background: Data from intersex civil societies show that intersex nonconsensual surgeries are not a thing of the past. They expressed concern at unnecessary surgeries on intersex children before they can provide consent. It called on the government to stop these. This has not happened.
attributes.additional_details: About 1 in 2000 children are born with genitalia considered atypical enough to prompt medical investigation. Nonconsensual treatment, according to studies, often causes severe physical and psychological harm to patients. We need to stop nonconsensual medical interventions, as the Maltan government did, and make sure that no one has to suffer nonconsensual treatment again. Being intersex is not a bad thing. Intersex people deserve to be protected from discrimination.

attributes.action: Set a minimum price per calorie for unhealthy foods
attributes.background: People have become accustomed to eating foods such as fast food, chocolate, sweets etc. These are unnecessarily high in calories and, as a result, directly fuel the obesity crisis. A minimum price per calorie would force these foods to be made with the same taste and far fewer calories.
attributes.additional_details:
Suggestion: 1p per calorie.  

E.g. In order to sell a typical fast food lunch of currently 1000 calories would cost a prohibitive £10.  In order to sell the same meal for £5, fast food chains would be forced to create the same, good tasting meal for only 500 calories.

attributes.action: Change the law to protect parental contributions for house purchase on divorce
attributes.background: 1000s of parents are donating money to their son or daughter’s house purchases. Parents are providing part or all of the large deposits required in today’s inflated UK housing market. Currently there is no law protecting these funds in the event of a divorce and the Government needs to address this.
attributes.additional_details:
Families are providing funds believing this money will stay with their children or indeed their grandchildren further down the line in the event of a divorce. This is not the case. Declaration of Trusts or similar deeds are ignored by judges and the non-contributing partner is wrongly benefitting.
Legal protection is needed to stop these contributions and inheritances disappearing from the original families.

attributes.action: End Child Maintenance for Shared care parents.
attributes.background: As it currently stands the resident parent can claim Child Maitanence from the other parent based on how many nights they stay with them. For example up to 57 nights per year is what the child maintanence service class as shared care but still the non resident parent has to pay maintanence.
attributes.additional_details: As an example I have a shared care arrangement with my daughters mum who has residency with them, they stay with me Wednesday - Saturday 7.30pm week 1 & Thursday - Saturday 7.30pm week 2. When they are with me they have everything they need E.g own school clothes, daily clothes, footwear Etc. Their mum claims child benefit & child tax credits for them and yet Child Maintanence Service (CMS) still claim I should still be paying more money to their mum. End the Equality for non resident parents!

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory 6 weeks Comunity Service for 18-year-olds
attributes.background: There are some 750,000 18-year-olds in the UK. Their service to our nation would not only be an invaluable help to our understaffed, overstretched national health and education services but would also reestablish the commitment and responsibility we, as individuals, feel towards our community.
attributes.additional_details: Our nation’s young adults are able to bring the energy, enthusiasm and hard work to revitalize our public service sectors. Driving ambulances, escorting elderly patients to and from medical procedures and helping out in the classroom (with the necessary background checks); these six weeks would provide not only an immense service to our country but also an ideological grounding for its citizens. The UK is experiencing a time of increasing social divide in which our people feel estranged from the nation as a whole. Working hands-on with members of our community would deepen our understanding of our society and revolutionize the role we feel we play in it. An elevated feeling of responsibly towards our society will prove imperative to its success.

attributes.action: Reduce preventable negligence cases within the NHS
attributes.background: Thousands of patients are being let down by avoidable errors made by the NHS. Errors such as failing to provide emergency care, mistakes in dispensing the correct drugs and dosages, misdiagnosis, delays in treatment, and incorrect treatment. This is harming patients and causing unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last decade, negligence claims against the NHS have quadrupled to an annual payout of £1.7 billion. This is set to double by 2021. This suggests a growing problem that isn't being dealt with effectively. Health leaders propose to address this issue by capping the amount of compensation that is paid out to victims. Yet this won't reduce the number of negligence cases. We need to invest more resources into identifying the root causes of the problem and in turn implementing a solution.

attributes.action: Instate a Queens day in honour of Queen Elizabeth the 2nd.
attributes.background: The Queen is a staple of Britain, I and many others believe she should have a bank holiday dedicated to her Highness.

attributes.action: A UK wide once in a generation special Public Holiday to clear the UK of Litter
attributes.background: I would like to propose a once in a generation special public holiday to get everyone outside with recycled bin bags & litter pickers to help clear & tidy up their local areas from the unsightly litter that we all come across from day to day but never have the time to do it.  The UK is beautiful!
attributes.additional_details: Since I was a child I always remember thinking why do people throw their litter out of cars or discard it whilst walking.  It is something that I really feel strongly about. so what can I do about it?  I could spend my time endlessly picking after people. Or better still encourage everyone to do it!

attributes.action: Protect consumers who order goods that are out of stock at the time.
attributes.background: Consumers currently have the right to a refund if unhappy with goods purchased online. They should have the same right when purchasing goods in a shop where the goods are out of stock at time of purchase; as with an Internet purchase, the consumer can't inspect the goods until they actually arrive.
attributes.additional_details: In the face-to-face scenario, it can happen that the goods are out of stock, the trader asks for payment prior to ordering the goods into stock, the trader receives the goods into stock, the consumer inspects the goods but is unhappy with them, then the trader refuses to refund the consumer’s money, forcing the consumer to either accept the goods or alternatively a credit note that may be of no use to the consumer.  I believe that consumers should have the right to a refund in this situation.

attributes.action: "PAMPER ON PRESCRIPTION" -  health professionals to prescribe holistic therapies
attributes.background: This idea could potentially save the NHS £millions.  As a sufferer from Mental Health issues I have often felt the need for relaxation to aid my stress levels, and have personal experience that even basic massage is the best relaxant and stress reliever ***(Please read 'more details' section)***
attributes.additional_details: The massage itself works wonders, but the talking that accompanies the treatment is also very therapeutic.  e.g. a simple hand massage.  To pay for these treatments can be relatively costly for me, but if I could access the therapies regularly, I would be able to cut down on expensive medication, thereby saving the NHS money.  I can advocate this idea as I know it works.

attributes.action: The UK Government should provide financial aid solutions for future pilots
attributes.background: A major factor driving fewer people to take up the career is the cost of training. Aspiring pilots, who aren’t able to secure a place on the limited number of airline sponsored training schemes, need to find large sums of money to pay for their own training costs which can be upwards of £100,000.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.ft.com/content/d7117f1e-d963-11e5-a72f-1e7744c66818

http://www.fta-global.com/fta-news/pilot-shortage-looms-but-uk-and-european-commercial-pilot-licence-issues-are-down

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/business-42917181/pilot-shortage-who-s-going-to-fly-our-planes

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-11691204

http://www.travelweekly.co.uk/articles/35126/balpa-warns-of-uk-pilot-shortage

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cigarettes in corner shops, only sell them in the supermarket
attributes.background: This will make younger people hard to buy the cigarette from the corner and this will make them go to the top 4 supermarkets because the supermarket will ask for ID and some corner shop do not ask for ID. This will help more people quit smoking and never start smoking in the first place.

attributes.action: Increase the number of GCSE options that schools offer
attributes.background: The choices we have for GCSE's can be very limited within schools. In my GCSE choices I only had nine other options, other than the core few. This has limited my possible learning and perhaps my future.
attributes.additional_details: The choices you have limit what is possible in the future for me and others with limited choices.

attributes.action: Stop Dartford toll fees.
attributes.background: The authorities said that as soon as the bridge was paid for the fees would stop.

attributes.action:
Higher Minimum Wage for anti-social hours
(11pm-6am).
attributes.background: Sometimes an employer will pay staff who work anti-social hours a higher wage than those who work normal hours, but not very often; especially in the bar industy. Working anti-social hours can put a strain on the health and limits people's chances to join in on family and social life.
attributes.additional_details: Unfortunately, there is no legal entitlement to increased pay for working anti-social hours, and I think this should change! Thanks

attributes.action: Make homework optional/non-compulsory and ban detention and isolation
attributes.background: Homework stresses young minds out. How are children expected to complete 15 pieces of homework a week for it simply to be glanced at? It is unfair for people to be kept in school against their will, but many schools in the UK do this. Action must be taken!

attributes.action: Require all UK betting shops to have security screens to protect staff.
attributes.background: The Gambling Commission recommends such screens but it is down to the Local Authority who issue licences whether or not they are needed. It should be a legal requirement for all Betting Shops to have safety screens. All Betting Shops should have them, like banks and Post Offices do.

attributes.action: To get more hospitals and health care centres back in local areas across the UK
attributes.background: Lack of hospitals and health care centres in Hertfordshire is a major issue as the nearest hospital is 18.5 miles and 36 minuets away this is not including traffic and other altercations.
attributes.additional_details: A hard working student striving to be the best at Longdean school was unfortunately caught up in an car accident, it was shocking to all the students and staff at this school, even more shocking was that it took 1 hour and 30 minuets for an ambulance to reach her and luckily she was  not injured and walked away with out a scratch but this was a wake up call to the students at Longdean school, to take action and create this petition.

attributes.action: Amend TUA 2016, so non-union members pay for benefits gained from Union work.
attributes.background:
Benefits negotiated by Trade unions at the workplace are enjoyed by union members & non-members alike.
e.g. Workplace offers 1% pay rise to workforce but through negotiations with trade union, an increased offer of 2.5% is agreed. Members & non-members alike are given a 2.5% pay rise as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Union members already make financial contribution to support their union to act on their behalf however non-members receive the benefit of this rise without having made any financial contribution to the costs of the union achieving this mutually beneficially outcome.
Make non-union members pay monthly contribution, not exceeding subs paid by union members or they will receive only the 1% payrise.

attributes.action: Change the voting system to proportional representation, dump FPTP
attributes.background: Proportional representation means that vote share in the population matches the amount of seats each party gets in an election. First past the post creates a huge disparity between vote share and seats in the House of Commons, with parties receiving millions of votes and just one seat. Details below
attributes.additional_details:
2015 Election:

•Conservatives - 331 seats, 11,334,226 votes (36.9%)

•Labour - 232 seats, 9,347,273 votes (30.4%)

•UKIP - 1 seat, 3,881,099votes (12.6%)

•Liberal Democrats - 8 seats, 2,415,916  votes (7.9%)

•Green Party - 1 seat, 1,57,630 votes (3.8%)


2017 Election:

•Conservatives - 318 seats, 13,636,684 votes (42.4%)

•Labour - 262 seats, 12,877,918 votes (40.0%)

•Lib Dems - 12 seats, 2,371,861 votes (7.4%)

•UKIP - 0 seats, 594,068 votes (1.8%)

bbc.co.uk/news/election/2017/results

attributes.action: Give the Firemen, the Police, The Emergency Services a National Day.
attributes.background: Recently, I celebrated my daughter's 4 year old birthday. I invited the local Fire crew, then local Police. I was absolutely overwhelmed with their kindness in turning up and taking the time in talking to the little ones, their patience, their absolute dedication to their job.
attributes.additional_details: They all have been through so much lately, and I got to realise, why do we celebrate the army, who rightly protect us (My little girl's father is ex military, bomb disposal), but not these people, who risk their life for us on a daily basis. They deserve our support. So very much. Please do help me giving them the chance to parade, be proud, be cheered, be supported.

attributes.action: Require 70% of National Park members be directly elected, 30% being appointees.
attributes.background: Residents of Parks have no vote on the policies and expenditure that affect much of their daily lives and yet they are taxpayers.  All present members are appointees who have no manifesto and no mandate; further, many appear as sinecures given to loyal foot-soldiers across the political spectrum.
attributes.additional_details: Members of the National Parks Authorities are each appointed by one of 3 routes: by the SoS; by local authorities overlapping a Park; by amalgams of Park Parishes.  Much as the power devolved to a Park is supposedly limited to Planning and environmental protection, by the control of funds and staff, the Authorities have more all-pervasive impacts on the lives of residents of the Parks than their local authorities that tax them.  The proposed 30%, SoS appointees represent special-interests.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for assisted living facilities in care homes.
attributes.background: How much do you think care homes cost per week? You'd be surprised to find out the national average is £600, excluding nursing. This high price tag does not match the quality of the services provided. Help us to change this, as well as your possible future.
attributes.additional_details: We are Team Ward from Preston NCS - Wave 4. NCS, which stands for National Citizen Service, is a programme which encourages young people to engage in social action and make a difference in society. Recently, we visited a local care home. We were shocked at the visible lack of staff to help support the service users when we arrived. After this experience, we decided we were going to try and make a difference by starting this petition.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Holiday firms to increase prices in school holidays
attributes.background:
Parents who take children on unauthorised term-time holidays cannot escape fines and criminal records.
The right to affordable holidays is being taken away by the system.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of parents arround the country  face a choice each year. Do they take their children out of school to go on a cheaper holidays.  Holiday prices during the School term are significantly cheaper than when taken during  official school holidays.
The government should look to ensure holidays during official holiday periods are affordable for all.
Safeguards should be legally put in place to prevent holidays firms over-inflating prices during key holiday periods.

attributes.action: Introduce sanctions for Whaling nations if the hunting of Whales does not cease.
attributes.background: These countries are hunting a protected species on the pretense they're for scientific research. In reality the Whale meat is for public consumption. The three countries actually trade the meat between themselves despite an international trade ban. Whaling quotas are actually increasing.
attributes.additional_details: Feb 2018 more than 120 pregnant female whales were among 333 killed during Japan’s annual summer hunt in Antarctica. Mar 2018, Norway has announced a 28% increase of its annual whaling quota to 1,278 whales to revive the declining hunt amid international controversy. Jun 2018, Iceland’s whaling season have granted its whalers a quota of 161 fin whales in 2018, compared to 150 in 2017. Jul 2018, Icelandic Whalers kill an endangered Blue Whale...a protected species.

attributes.action: Lower the tax on alcohol sold in pubs and clubs
attributes.background: Once the local pub or club was the centre of a community, people met their future spouses, discussed their problems and received help, made friends and built a network of support encouraging a communal spirit and mental well-being. Cheap alcohol consumption from an off licence fosters non of this.
attributes.additional_details: There is a rising level of mental health issues / youth disorders I believe can be linked to the lose of community spirit. Clubs and pubs can form a focal point of this along side health and fitness centers, recreational clubs and community centers.  The tax on alcohol should be lowered in pubs / clubs to encourage people to get out and socialize rather than consume alcohol at home from off licence premises.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down and their vision may become impaired.

attributes.action: No more than 1 junction or 5 miles of roadworks, on a motorway or  A road
attributes.background:
This causes a lot of congestion and stand still traffic, there is more likely to be a road traffic incident in roadworks. 
Most of the time road works are only been worked on in a 1 mile stretch, there is no need for so many miles to be closed for years and years
attributes.additional_details:
M6- over 20 miles of motorway 2 miles of workers max, incidents at least 1 aday, 
M5 1 junction 2-3,bridge repairs hardly any incidents and not as much congestion

attributes.action: Discontinue Pay As You Dine and Reinstate Monthly Food Charges
attributes.background: Before Pay As You Dine British servicemen and women were charged a monthly food cost paid from their wages automatically, this ensured every soldier had 3 meals per day should they choose to eat at the cook house, since Payd came in the food quality has dropped dramatically, time to change!
attributes.additional_details:
Also because of lack of education and poor management a small population of soldiers have been put in a position where they cannot afford to eat, leaving the option to go “Hungry Soldier” this is incredibly degrading and embarrassing 

Discontinuing PAYD would be so much more beneficial for the servicemen of our country on a number of fronts

Things have to change

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow pupils to wear skirts
attributes.background: Gender expression must not be influenced by anyone in anyway. All pupils must be allowed to wear skirts or trousers. Ability to make a choice without being judged in gender expression is important for healthy development.

attributes.action: Enforce a limit on the cost of vehicle insurance for young and new drivers
attributes.background: Insurance in the UK has been continuously on the rise for several years. The cost of insurance for young drivers aged 17 years old even on low powered, low insurance grouped vehicles can run them up to the likes of £1500-£3000 with no cap. The average cost a new young driver will pay is around £2000
attributes.additional_details:
This has been a well known fact for many years that insurance companies have been picking out every penny they can from young and new drivers with no justification. The cost of insurance supercedes the price of many young drivers value of the car sometimes up to 5 times.
This is hindering young drivers from wanting to drive and becoming independent as the cost is becoming extortionate and is only rising every year. There needs to be a cap on the amount insurance companies can charge.

attributes.action: Add to the school curriculum, educating young people on current world issues
attributes.background: Educating from an early age, it would bring awareness of current issues and give young people a voice as they would have opportunities to get involved. This is important as they are the next generation, therefore, it is vital that they are aware of what is currently happening in the world.

attributes.action: Strip abusive parents of parental rights
attributes.background: Many parents are in impossible situations and have to meet face-to-face with an abuser who has parental rights. As soon as a parent is accused of such a thing, contact should be supervised and if convicted they should lose parental rights.
attributes.additional_details: I just want justice for all parents who have been abused mentally or physically, to give them chance to live.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to allow Northern England to claim independence.
attributes.background: Northern England is always the most underfunded out of everywhere in the UK. We in northern England pay taxes, yet it is always the south that spends it. We have the worst public transport system in the UK, and many other services including the NHS receive the smallest amount of funding in England.
attributes.additional_details:
Northern England should be allowed to hold a referendum on whether we should claim independence from England and form our own country within the UK.

Northern England is always forgotten about in the south including Downing Street. The government does not fund or maintain northern England properly as it should. 

We in northern England pay taxes, yet the south spends it. It is time to hold a referendum in Northern England !
